dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3233 IH: Diversifying by Investing in Educators and Students to Improve Outcomes For Youth Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. García of Illinois (for himself, Mrs. Hayes, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, Mr. Bowman, Mr. Bishop of Georgia, Ms. Brown, Mrs. McBath, Mr. Auchincloss, Mr. Moulton, Ms. Chu, Ms. Titus, Ms. Tlaib, Mr. Pocan, Mr. Trone, Ms. Bush, Mr. Torres of New York, Ms. Strickland, Ms. DelBene, Mr. Grijalva, Ms. Tokuda, and Mr. Soto) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, and in addition to the Committee on the Budget, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To remove college cost as a barrier to every student having access to a well-prepared and diverse educator workforce, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Diversifying by Investing in Educators and Students to Improve Outcomes For Youth Act or the Diversify Act.

section.header: Amendments to the TEACH Grants program under the Higher Education Act of 1965
section.text: Subpart 9 of part A of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070g et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 420L(1), by inserting (except that such term does not include an institution described in subsection (a)(1)(A) of section 102) after 102;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)(1), by striking $4,000 and inserting $8,000;

in subsection (b)(3), by striking the second and third sentences and inserting the following: Any disbursement allowed to be made by crediting the teacher candidate's account shall be used for the full cost of attendance (as defined in section 472).; and

clause.text: in paragraph (1)(B), by striking $16,000 and inserting $32,000; and
in paragraph (2), by striking $8,000 and inserting $16,000; and
by striking an agreement and all that follows through the applicant will and inserting an agreement by the applicant that the applicant will;
by redesignating subparagraphs (A) through (E) as paragraphs (1) through (5), respectively, and moving the margins of such paragraphs (as so redesignated) 2 ems to the left;

in paragraph (3), as so redesignated, by redesignating clauses (i) through (vii) as subparagraphs (A) through (G), respectively, and moving the margins of such subparagraphs (as so redesignated) 2 ems to the left;

in paragraph (2), as redesignated by clause (iii), by striking teach in a school described in section 465(a)(2)(A) and inserting teach in a school described in section 465(a)(2)(A) or teach in a high-need early childhood education program (defined in section 200(9)); and
in paragraph (3), as redesignated by clause (iii)—

subclause.text: in subparagraph (F), as redesignated by clause (iv), by striking or after the semicolon;
in subparagraph (G), as redesignated by clause (iv), by inserting or after the semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:

subsection.text: Upon the completion of the service requirement in subsection (b), the Secretary shall send to the recipient of a grant under this subpart an electronic certificate documenting the completion of such service.

subparagraph.text: by inserting after subsection (c) the following:

subsection.text: The Secretary may not institute or create a monetary penalty for failure or refusal to complete the service requirement under subsection (b).

subparagraph.text: in subsection (e), as redesignated by subparagraph (C)—

clause.text: by striking subsection (b)(1)(C)(vii) and inserting subsection (b)(3)(G); and
by striking subsection (b)(1) and inserting subsection (b).

section.header: Amendment to the balanced budget and deficit control act

subsection.text: Section 255(h) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (2 U.S.C. 905(h)) is amended by inserting after the item relating to Supplemental Security Income Program (28–0406–0–1–609). the following new item:

paragraph.text: TEACH Grants under subpart 9 of part A of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to any sequestration order issued under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (2 U.S.C. 900 et seq.) on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
